string-array.name: vaccine_info
string-array.item: According to CDC guidelines, all children aged 11 to 12 years should receive one dose of meningococcal conjugate vaccine. Since immunity from this vaccine decreases over time, those vaccinated before age 16 need a booster dose at least 8 weeks apart, preferably between ages 16 and 18. (CDC recommendation, 2024)

Children under 13 years: The first dose of chickenpox vaccine is usually given at 12–15 months and the second at 4–6 years. The minimum age for the first dose is 12 months. If a dose is given before 12 months, it is not valid and must be repeated at 12–15 months (at least 3 months after the invalid dose). In certain cases (e.g., outbreaks), the second dose can be given before age 4. The minimum recommended interval between doses is 3 months, but if the second dose is given at least 28 days after the first, no repeat is needed. Children under 13 who have received fewer than 2 doses should complete their schedule. If the interval between doses exceeds the recommendation, the schedule does not need to restart. Adolescents and adults: Unvaccinated individuals aged 13+ without a history of chickenpox should receive two doses 4–8 weeks apart. Those with one previous dose should get a second dose, at least 28 days apart.
CDC post-exposure recommendations for varicella: CDC recommends vaccination for healthy, unvaccinated persons aged 12+ months without evidence of immunity within 5 days of exposure to reduce disease severity. Ideally within 3 days for over 90% protection. A second dose post-exposure is recommended for those with only one prior dose, for better future protection. Note: In Iran, chickenpox vaccination is not mandatory as it is not part of the national immunization program, and may increase the risk of shingles later in life.

The best time for vaccination is late September to mid-October, but high-risk individuals (children under 2, people with AIDS, those 6 months–18 years on long-term aspirin) should be vaccinated whenever they visit. The Iranian FluGuard vaccine is not recommended for those under 18.
